instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots once and then gets stuck at 223mA
threads.message:
I'm working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that came in with water damage. After fixing this the board now behaves as follows:
It starts normally when booting for the first time. After that it always gets stuck at approx. 223mA.
If it has been off for a while, it starts up again normally for one boot process. Then again stuck at 223mA ...

I measured all Power Aliases from page 62 while it stucks at 223mA - they are all good.
Can you give me a tip on how to continue troubleshooting?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots once and then gets stuck at 223mA
threads.message:
Any history available?
Tried PRAM reset?
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> stays high?

Just in case, try new full BIOS, clean ME.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots once and then gets stuck at 223mA
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is high when the board is up on 500-600mA.
When it stucks at 223mA <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is low.

History:
Customers story: A glass of water leaked over the Macbook, I immediately tried to remove everything and switched off the Macbook, but the screen only flickered and then the Macbook could not be switched on at all.

When it came in, the logic board had numerous spots on both sides with signs of corrosion, but these were not very strong, We cleaned them with flux and heatgun and the board did get an ultrasonic. I have videos from the board before beginning with work - if it helps i can give an downloadlink or upload a view pictures.

What i did now:
I made a new BIOS with Medusa3 from a Donor with clean ME and PRAM.
And i changed <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> because it had a bit corrosion before and was only cleaned with flux.
At my first test the board was booting two times like normal up to 500-600mA.
But after this it is now only booting to 223mA every time.
I changed <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> a second time - just in case the chip is not good - same behavior. 
Around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, <CHIP>U6101</CHIP>, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, Y1905 and J6100 i measured in diode-mode all the values from FlexBV OBData - all seems good.
FYI - i can't see any data transfer on the oszi at the Circuits from the BIOS. They have 3.3v but no data signs.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots once and then gets stuck at 223mA
threads.message:
Check <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pins 7 & 3 voltage, when board is stuck.
If get voltage, then check <SIGNAL>CPU_VCCST_PWRGD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CPU_VR_READY</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots once and then gets stuck at 223mA
threads.message:
<CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pin7 = 320mV and pin3 = 350mV (not stable, the value falls continuously during the measurement)
<SIGNAL>CPU_VCCST_PWRGD</SIGNAL> = 1,02V
<SIGNAL>CPU_VR_READY</SIGNAL> = 1,05V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots once and then gets stuck at 223mA
threads.message:
What about <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> at same time?
If low, remove <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR> and test again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots once and then gets stuck at 223mA
threads.message:
I had a look under <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> - pin8 was corroded - the board boots now !
At the moment there is now a problem with the SSD - questionmark folder. That's new - the SSD was running before.
Could this have something to do with the new BIOS? At the moment there is the new BIOS on board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots once and then gets stuck at 223mA
threads.message:
I changed the original BIOS back - the SSD is running now.
Is this behavior normal? Must i Install/Configure the SSD after changing the BIOS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots once and then gets stuck at 223mA
threads.message: Nothing strange; new BIOS didn't have APFS support...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots once and then gets stuck at 223mA
threads.message: cool - thanks for your help - machine is running
